p:
Edible vegetable oil forms an integral part of the human diet and consists of triacylglycerol (95–98%) and other trace compounds (2–5%),
6 which can provide most of the fatty acids required by the human body for physiological activities. Furthermore, edible vegetable oil also contains certain amounts of vitamin E and phytochemicals, such as phytosterols and squalene.
7− 9
